GOD.content: Schmitt separates private and public too quickly

R.content: Schmitt is right, a pure sovereignty (decisionist exceptionality) is indivisible or not at all, it’s ahistorical, withdraws from language, does not exist > incompatible w/ universality & internationality that always calls for it

HERP.content: for Schmitt, being-toward-death occurs in the political, which requires an enemy

difference btwn Schmitt & Heidegger: polemos is everything for both but it’s not a “human war” for Heidegger [see also pp. 211-12 can Heideggerian hearing of Kampf be distinguished from [Nazi] regime? if strategy re: decision is not formalizable—is this still not a war economy?]

POOF.content: Schmittian decisionism implies the instance of the subject > a classic, free, willful subject to whom nothing can happen, not even an exceptional event [?]
Schmitt’s Nazism as part of his lucidity, the courage of his fear, his attunement to all border-crossings he needed to repress > some surprising filiations btwn Marxist & Schmittian thought
